result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Nmi Drapes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Transfer to Green Lake County granted.
Concurrent with: with 14CM85.

miscConds.notes: Work out payment plan with Agent.
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with Bookcellar premises.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: JOC
C: Defendant, DOC
C: Defendant, DOC

Defendant Jerome Nmi Drapes in court with attorney Katherine Seifert. 
James H. Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights, and enters no contest plea to 15CM50 #3. 
Per Atty Seifert, parties stipulate to termination of DPA in 14CM85. 
Per ADA Fassbender, State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty regarding 15CM50 #3 and 14CM85 #1. 
15CM50 #1 and #2 are dismissed and read in. 
Case 15CM51 is dismissed. 
Court orders sentence withheld, probation 1 year, concurrent, with transfer to Green Lake County. 
Conditions:
- pay costs/supervision fees
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations
- no contact, directly or indirectly, with 14CM85: Craig J Ganther, David Koeppler, Kristy Schulfer, 15CM50: Bookcellar premises
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
Atty Seifert - reported new address
